text:
Not sure if it is intended or a bug, but I was surprised that one cannot use keyword splatting in a `do` block
```julia> somefunction() do args...; kwargs...
           args
       end```

elements.text: Not sure if it is intended or a bug, but I was surprised that one cannot use keyword splatting in a

julia> somefunction() do args...; kwargs...
           args
       end

text: a bit of an apprecigripe, because I generally find julia very consistent, so I was definitely expecting this to work

elements.text: a bit of an apprecigripe, because I generally find julia very consistent, so I was definitely expecting this to work

text: Do open an issue about this, this should probably work

elements.text: Do open an issue about this, this should probably work

text: but maybe it would need some parentheses?  free `...` aren't usually allowed, no?

elements.text: but maybe it would need some parentheses?  free

text: In `do` blocks, parentheses do generally matter though, i.e. `do x, y` creates a 2-arg closure, while `do (x, y)` does destructuring
